intro: Agathophyllum tapak, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and finely divided leaves. It is well adapted to dry environments, with deep roots that help it access underground water. Agathophyllum tapak is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
